entry.title: Phonovideo
entry.content: Motionographer has this great article on a student project by Clemens Kogler with a process he calls Phonovideo. All of the animations are shot and edited live on this turntable videomixer contraption - stands on its own without knowing the whole process, but knowing just makes me flush... and he's a student - that's a kick in the pants.

entry.title: Zach Ferguson wins Project Never
entry.content: The winner of this year's Project Never has been announced. The great creative work that never saw the light of day (until now) belongs to Zach Ferguson from Austin, Texas. Zach's designs for Honest Don's Chop Shop — a butcher shop that specializes in quality, local meats and cheeses through a classic deli storefront — were rejected for being “too stylish”. Is there really such a thing, Honest Don? Honestly. Zach will receive a great prize package from the event sponsors, including a 1,500-credit pack for Veer Marketplace. You can see a slideshow of Zach's designs on the Project Never website.

entry.title: Upscale lo-fi
entry.content: Lo-fi photography gives everyone the chance to take a cool shot. No need for school or experience when a world-distorting plastic lens usually creates art or at the very least something weird. By giving film another chance, society gains more of the strange. Kitsune Noir takes a closer look at the new Lomo store recently opened in LA. Giant mosaics abound.

entry.title: Spend the summer designing at Veer
entry.content: Summer approaches, and we're looking for a new summer design intern. This is a paid position that includes airfare and an apartment near the office. The application deadline is April 15, 2010. You'll spend your summer in Calgary, Alberta (that's in Canada) crafting visual delights for four international brands. You'll make good use of unlimited access to every photograph, illustration, and the more than 9000 typefaces in our collections. And that's just the 9ish to 5ish. There's also plenty to do in the downtime. The Veer office (and your apartment) is in a great area full of restaurants, bars, and cafes. The mountains are close, if hiking, camping, or climbing is your thing. And the summer is packed with concerts, festivals, and the Calgary Stampede. Hundreds of new best friends await you. Check out the official details, read up on some of our past interns, and apply! Photo Credit: Lindsey Baker

entry.title: Bienal Tipos Latinos & TDC Awards
entry.content: Congratulations to Alejandro Paul, whose new font Brownstone (coming soon) received a Certificate of Excellence - the highest type award in Latin America - at Bienal Tipos Latinos 2010. HIs Kewl Script, Semilla, Business Penmanship, and Calgary Script were also selected to be part of the exhibition. Recently, Neil Summerour's Fugu and Michael Doret's Deliscript both received nods from the prestigious Type Directors Club.

entry.title: From sea to shining sea
entry.content: From Sea to Shining Sea is a retro travel poster series from design & illustration duo Jason Kernevich and Dustin Summers. So far there are 8 prints, paying tribute to Miami, New York, Seattle, Philadelphia, Chicago, San Francisco, Washington D.C., and Phoenix. Your time will come, Lost Springs, Wyoming. via Coudal

entry.title: Typography in advertising

entry.title: Veer at SXSW Interactive 2010
entry.content: If you're in Austin, TX this week for SXSW Interactive, stop by the Veer both and say hello to a mix of folks from the Veer creative & marketing teams. There's a limited edition t-shirt you might want to get your hands on, and that's the place to do it. We'll also be giving away FABULOUS PRIZES during the conference. To keep an eye on those announcements, follow @VeerUpdate on Twitter. AND... if you love photos, type, strolling, interesting people, and beverages... grab your camera on Sunday and join Veer alum/founder Grant Hutchinson at the annual SXSW Found Type Photowalk.

entry.title: Buy “Coming Together”, support Haiti
entry.content: In response to the devastating 2010 earthquake in Haiti, the Society of Typographic Aficionados issued a call to action to the typographic and design communities to participate in Font Aid IV. The result was Coming Together, an OpenType font that contains over 400 ampersand glyphs designed by participants from around the world. All proceeds from the sale of the typeface go to Doctors Without Borders, in support of continuing relief efforts in Haiti. Get it here for just $20.
